Detailed Description

Managing list of OBEX headers.

This class serves as a container for ObexHeader elements. List elements are immutable and are managed by the list, therefore when an ObexHeaderList instance is deleted all its elements are destroyed, too.

The list offers an iterator which can be used to conveniently examine individual headers and extract their value.

Example: 

    // Function extracts NAME and TYPE header values, when available ...
    static void ExtractNameAndType(const ObexHeaderList &   list)
    {
        // Loop over list elements one after another
        for ( ObexHeaderList::ConstIterator it = list.Begin();
                                            it.IsValid();
                                          ++it ) {
            WString     name_str;
            String      type_str;

            // Check for desired headers by looking at their ID's
            switch( it->GetId() ) {
                case ObexHeader::Name :
                    // NAME headers present (unicode), save value
                    name_str = it->ToWString();
                    break;

                case ObexHeader::Type :
                    // TYPE header present (ascii), save value
                    type_str = it->ToString();
                    break;

                default:
                    // Ignore other header types
                    break;
            }
        }
        // Evaluate name / type information ...
    }

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ObexHeaderList::ObexHeaderList (   ) 
 

Default constructor. Constructs an empty ObexHeaderList.

ObexHeaderList::~ObexHeaderList (   ) 
 

Destructor. Destroys an ObexHeaderList.

At destruction time, all ObexHeader elements within the list are deleted. Any iterators referring to the list must not be used anymore.

Adds an OBEX header build by an ObexHeaderBuilder to the list.

Example: 

            ObexResult  res = list.AddHeader( ObexHeader::Length, 1000) );

ObexResult ObexHeaderList::AddHeader (  INT  id,
const UINT8  data[],
UINT16  data_size
) 
 

Adds an byte sequence type OBEX header to the list.

Example: 

            UINT8 data[] = {0x00, 0x01, 0x02, 0x03};

            ObexResult  res = list.AddHeader( ObexHeader::AppParams, data, sizeof(data)) );

Parameters:
id Header id of the header to be added.
data Byte array from which data is copied into the header.
data_size Size of the data within the array in octets.
Returns:
'TRUE' in case of success, 'FALSE' otherwise.

ObexHeaderList::ConstIterator ObexHeaderList::Find (  ObexHeader::HeaderId  id,
ConstIterator  from
)  const
 

Find first header whose header Id equals the given one.

Parameters:
id Header Id of the OBEX header to be retrieved.
from Position in the list where to start searching.
Returns:
Iterator referring to the corresponding header if one was found, invalid iterator otherwise.

MimeType ObexHeaderList::ObtainMimeType (   )  const
 

Determines the mime type of an object from the header list.

This method scans the header list for a TYPE header. If found, it is used to determine the mimetype, otherwise when a NAME header is present an attempt is made to obtain the type from its extension.

Returns:
MimeType of the object in case of success, 'c_mime_unknown' in case of error.
